      • getUserConnectionInfo

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getUserConnectionInfo()
                                                                                 throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns a hash describing all defined userconn "user connections" or "null" if no user connections are defined Example: 
        
        HashMap<String, Object> h = omqclient.getUserConnectionInfo();
        Returns:
        a hash describing all defined userconn "user connections" or "null" if no user connections are defined; keys are user connection names; hash values correspond to the return value of ConnectionProvider::AbstractConnection::getInfo()
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        Note:
        connection-specific exceptions could be thrown initializing connections

      • getUserConnectionInfo

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getUserConnectionInfo​(java.lang.String name)
                                                                                 throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns a hash describing the given userconn "user connection" Example: 
        
        HashMap<String, Object> h = omqclient.getUserConnectionInfo(name);
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the userconn "connection"
        Returns:
        a hash describing the given userconn "user connections"; the return value corresponds to the return value of ConnectionProvider::AbstractConnection::getInfo(); if the connection is invalid or unknown an exception is thrown
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - CONNECTION-ERROR The given connection is invalid or unknown
        Note:
        connection-specific exceptions could be thrown initializing connections

      • getUserConnectionUrl

        public java.lang.String getUserConnectionUrl​(java.lang.String name)
                                      throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns the URL corresponding to a defined userconn "user connection" Example: 
        
        String url = omqclient.getUserConnectionUrl(name);
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the userconn "connection"
        Returns:
        the URL string for the connection
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - CONNECTION-ERROR The given connection is invalid or unknown
        Note:
        other connection-specific exceptions could be thrown initializing connections

      • getDatasourceConnectionString

        public java.lang.String getDatasourceConnectionString​(java.lang.String name)
                                               throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns the datasource connection string for the given datasource if defined in dsconn Example: 
        
        String connstr = omqclient.getDatasourceConnectionString("app2");
        An exception is thrown if the datasource is not known
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the datasource to retrieve
        Returns:
        the datasource connection string for the given datasource
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - INVALID-DATASOURCE unknown datasource
        See Also:
        getDatasourcePool()

      • getDatasourcePool

        public org.qore.lang.DatasourcePool getDatasourcePool​(java.lang.String name,
                                                      int min,
                                                      int max)
                                               throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns a DatasourcePool object for the given string if defined in dsconn Example: 
        
DatasourcePool app2p = omqclient.getDatasourcePool("app2");
        An exception is thrown if the datasource is not known. The same DatasourcePool object will always be returned from this method.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the datasource to use as a basis for creating the DatasourcePool object
        min - override the minimum connection setting
        max - override the maximum connection setting
        Returns:
        the DatasourcePool object for the given string
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        See Also:
        getNewDatasourcePool()

      • getDatasourcePool

        public org.qore.lang.DatasourcePool getDatasourcePool​(java.lang.String name)
                                               throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns a DatasourcePool object for the given string if defined in dsconn Example: 
        
DatasourcePool app2p = omqclient.getDatasourcePool("app2");
        An exception is thrown if the datasource is not known. The same DatasourcePool object will always be returned from this method.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the datasource to use as a basis for creating the DatasourcePool object
        Returns:
        the DatasourcePool object for the given string
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        See Also:
        getNewDatasourcePool()

      • getNewDatasourcePool

        public org.qore.lang.DatasourcePool getNewDatasourcePool​(java.lang.String name,
                                                         int min,
                                                         int max)
                                                  throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns a new DatasourcePool object for the given string if defined in dsconn Example: 
        
DatasourcePool app2p = omqclient.getNewDatasourcePool("app2");
        An exception is thrown if the datasource is not known
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the datasource to use as a basis for creating the DatasourcePool object
        min - the minumum number of connections to open when the object is created
        max - the maximum number of connections to manage; not more than these connections will be opened
        Returns:
        the Datasource object for the given string
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        See Also:
        getDatasourcePool()

      • getRemoteInfo

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getRemoteInfo()
                                                                         throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns a hash of remoteconn "remote connections" keyed by remote connection name or nothing if no remoteconn "remote connections" are defined Example: 
        
HashMap<String, Object> h = omqclient.getRemoteInfo();
        Returns:
        a hash of remoteconn "remote connections" keyed by remote connection name or nothing if no remoteconn "remote connections" are defined; hash values correspond to the return value of ConnectionProvider::AbstractConnection::getInfo()
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - REMOTE-LOAD-ERROR Missing remoteconn config file or malformed syntax

      • getRemoteInfo

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getRemoteInfo​(java.lang.String name)
                                                                         throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns a hash of the given remoteconn "remote connection" Example: 
        
HashMap<String, Object> h = omqclient.getRemoteInfo(conn);
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the remoteconn "remote connection"
        Returns:
        a hash of the given remoteconn "remote connection"; the return value corresponds to the return value of ConnectionProvider::AbstractConnection::getInfo(); if the connection is invalid or unknown, an exception is thrown
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - REMOTE-LOAD-ERROR Missing remoteconn configuration or malformed syntax
        java.lang.Throwable - GET-REMOTE-ERROR requested connection is not defined

      • getRemoteRest

        public QorusSystemRestHelper getRemoteRest​(java.lang.String name,
                                           boolean connect)
                                    throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns a connection for RESTful communication with a remote Qorus server based on connection parameters parsed in the remoteconn
        Parameters:
        name - a string key/name of the remote instance
        connect - if Qore::False "False", then the object will be created in an unconnected state
        Returns:
        a QorusSystemRestHelper instance corresponding to the remote instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - REMOTE-LOAD-ERROR Missing remoteconn configuration or malformed syntax
        java.lang.Throwable - GET-REMOTE-ERROR requested connection is not defined

      • getRemoteRest

        public QorusSystemRestHelper getRemoteRest​(java.lang.String name)
                                    throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns a connection for RESTful communication with a remote Qorus server based on connection parameters parsed in the remoteconn
        Parameters:
        name - a string key/name of the remote instance
        Returns:
        a QorusSystemRestHelper instance corresponding to the remote instance; the object will already be connected when returned
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - REMOTE-LOAD-ERROR Missing remoteconn configuration or malformed syntax
        java.lang.Throwable - GET-REMOTE-ERROR requested connection is not defined

      • getRemoteConfig

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getRemoteConfig​(java.lang.String name,
                                                                                  boolean with_password)
                                                                           throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns a hash with connection parameters for a remote Qorus server based on connection parameters parsed in the remoteconn
        Parameters:
        name - a string key/name of the remote instance
        with_password - if True then the password is also returned
        Returns:
        a hash with connection parameters
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - REMOTE-LOAD-ERROR Missing remoteconn configuration or malformed syntax
        java.lang.Throwable - GET-REMOTE-ERROR requested connection is not defined

      • getRemoteConfig

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getRemoteConfig​(java.lang.String name)
                                                                           throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns a hash with connection parameters for a remote Qorus server based on connection parameters parsed in the remoteconn
        Parameters:
        name - a string key/name of the remote instance
        Returns:
        a hash with connection parameters; no password info is returned with this variant
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - REMOTE-LOAD-ERROR Missing remoteconn configuration or malformed syntax
        java.lang.Throwable - GET-REMOTE-ERROR requested connection is not defined

      • setDatasourceFromText

        public void setDatasourceFromText​(java.lang.String line)
                           throws java.lang.Throwable
        This method allows a datasource to be created or redefined from the text passed Example: 
        
        omqclient.setDatasourceFromText("omq=driver:user/pass@db%host:port");
        Parameters:
        line - the datasource text to use to create or redefine a datasource (ex: dsname=driver:user/pass@@dbname%host:port)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • createWorkflowInstanceID

        public int createWorkflowInstanceID​(int wfid,
                                    java.lang.String ext_order_id,
                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> sdata,
                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> ddata,
                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> orderkeys,
                                    int priority,
                                    int pwfiid)
                             throws java.lang.Throwable
        Creates a workflow order data instance from the workflowid and order parameters and returns the workflow_instanceid
        Parameters:
        wfid - the workflow ID of the workflow order to create
        ext_order_id - the optional external_order_instanceid of the workflow order to create; may be null, but at least one of ext_order_id and sdata must be present
        sdata - the static data for the order; may be null, but at least one of ext_order_id and sdata must be present
        ddata - the dynamic data for the order; may be null
        orderkeys - a hash giving the order keys for the order (key=value); may be null
        priority - gives the order priority (default OMQ.DefaultOrderPriority)
        pwfiid - the loosely-coupled parent workflow instance ID
        Returns:
        a string giving the new workflow_instanceid for the workflow order created
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - CREATE-ORDER-ERROR missing both static data and external order instance ID arguments

      • createWorkflowInstanceID

        public int createWorkflowInstanceID​(int wfid,
                                    java.lang.String ext_order_id,
                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> sdata,
                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> ddata,
                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> orderkeys,
                                    int pwfiid)
                             throws java.lang.Throwable
        Creates a workflow order data instance from the workflowid and order parameters and returns the workflow_instanceid
        Parameters:
        wfid - the workflow ID of the workflow order to create
        ext_order_id - the optional external_order_instanceid of the workflow order to create; may be null, but at least one of ext_order_id and sdata must be present
        sdata - the static data for the order; may be null, but at least one of ext_order_id and sdata must be present
        ddata - the dynamic data for the order; may be null
        orderkeys - a hash giving the order keys for the order (key=value); may be null
        pwfiid - the loosely-coupled parent workflow instance ID
        Returns:
        a string giving the new workflow_instanceid for the workflow order created
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - CREATE-ORDER-ERROR missing both static data and external order instance ID arguments

      • parseOptionsFile

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> parseOptionsFile​(java.lang.String fn)
                                                                                   throws java.lang.Throwable
        Parses the given file as a Qorus option file and returns a hash Returns a hash of the option information, keyed by "domain" (i.e. qorus, qorus-client); the return hash only has the option data that is set in the file; no options are derived or automatically set by this method
        Parameters:
        fn - the file name of the options file to parse
        Returns:
        a hash of the options keyed by "domain" (i.e. qorus, qorus-client)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • parseDatasource

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> parseDatasource​(java.lang.String str)
                                                                                  throws java.lang.Throwable
        Parses a datasource string and returns the hash An exception will be thrown if no driver name is given
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
